name: Monster Mix-Up
description:
Mix it up or match it up and be the first to build a monster and race to the finish.

Object of the game is to be the first player to return home after building a complete monster (all four monster parts from the same or different monsters).

The youngest player starts the game by rolling the die and moving that number of spaces. Player can move in any direction around the board or use the arrows to guide them. If a player lands on a monster space, she draws a monster card from the draw pile and places it face up in front of her. If a player lands on a Mix-Up space, she can trade one card with another player. If a player land on Home space, she can return to the Monster Mix-up home space in the center of the board. If a player land on a Put 1 Back space, she must return one of her monster cards to the middle of the draw pile. Players continue to move around the board, collecting monster cards to build their monsters. Once a player has a complete monster, she races back to the Monster Mix-Up home space.

name: Junkyard King
description:
It takes both a keen eye and a bit of luck to make it in the world of junk. Players scrape and collect the best junk on their way to becoming the most profitable junkyard!

The game is played in rounds. Each round represents a month of time in which the players collect the most valuable cards they can from the deck or the discard pile, trying to avoid accidentally trashing their valuables in the process. As each round ends, the total value of the collected cards are added to each player's score.

The first player to reach $10,000 is declared the Junkyard King!

name: Standard Action: The Card Game
description: In Standard Action: the Card Game, players build a 4-member adventuring party and set out to earn a reputation as the greatest adventurers in the world. Each round, players gather party members and important items in Town, and then head out Adventuring to earn Reputation Points. The first player to 10 points is the winner.

name: Who's Your Heavenly Father?
description:
Players aim to deduce who the One True God is, and to become virtuous in His eyes, before Judgment Day.

Each of the 10 possible gods prefers a different combination of the four virtues: Benevolence, Justice, Selfishness, and Xenophobia. Players accumulate virtue tokens by responding to cards with moral dilemmas, hypothetical situations in which they must choose between exhibiting one virtue or another. They may also use Prophet and Skeptic cards to look at the false gods, deducing the identity of the One True God by process of elimination.

Eventually someone will call for Judgment Day, when the One True God is revealed and players receive positive or negative points depending on which virtues that god liked or did not like.

After numerous battles and heroic efforts, a much-desired rest aould arrive for every soldier. Well-deserved leave - Furlough - during which it was possible to visit home or a fiancée. Easy to say, hard to accomplish. The war continues, and there are disuptions everywhere and overcrowded trains. Cossacks are prowling along the roads and suspicious Austrian military policemen are looking on marching from the front soldiers. Our Furlough is in force only for the week - 7 short days and nights. The soldiers must act quickly and count on a bit of luck.

Przepustka (A Furlough) is a game intended for 2, 3, 4 or 5 players. Each of players controls two soldiers - using movement cards they help them reach family and friends safely and don't get into trouble. Victory points are awarded for visited destinations. It is also possible to gain these points thanks to cards or by visiting storage locations. The winner is the player whose soldiers manage to gather most victory points.

name: Race to Riches
description:
For party and holiday!

Combined bid, luck, contest in a game.

The rules are simple, the process of stimulation, and yet joyous explosion point game depth, especially for playing together in the New Year with their families!

This is not only a game, but also is table decorations!

Do follow 7 steps in a round:
Step 1: Auction to become the banker.
Step 2: The banker pay into Money Pool, choose a Race Card and receive 6 Point Cards.
Step 3: All player except banker place a Large/Small Betting Card.
Step 4: All player except banker guess the banker's Point Cards.
Step 5: Show Point Cards and distribute the Money Pool to those players who made the correct bet.
Step 6: The banker moves statues of deities forward.
Step 7: End the current round.

Race Card is worth $80 for the first place, 60 for the second place, 30 for the third place, 0 for the fourth place. Each player sum the values of Game Coins and Race Cards in his/her possession. The player with the largest sum wins the game.

name: CHEW: Cases of the FDA
description:
Description from the publisher:

Based on the Eisner Award-winning comic series by John Layman and Rob Guillory, CHEW: Cases of the FDA seats 2-5 players and is playable in about 30 minutes. Players compete to close cases pulled directly from the pages of the ongoing comic book. They'll enlist partners like John Colby, Amelia Mintz, and even Buttercup the lion, while simultaneously sending fiendish villains and cultists out to sabotage their rivals' investigations.

name: Bocce Piatta
description:
Did your Mother tell you not to play ball in the house?
Well, now you can. 
With Bocce Piatta you can play a game of Bocce just about anywhere. 
Bocce Piatta is a table top version of the classic ball sport Bocce.

The starting player tosses the Pallino disc onto a flat surface and players take turns tossing their Bocce Ball cards in an attempt to get closest to the Pallino. Points are scored just like the real game of Bocce.

Bocce Piatta comes with 12 cards in 3 pairs of warm colors and 3 pairs of cool colors, so it can be played by 2 players or up to 6 players in teams.

Bocce Piatta can be played on just about any flat surface. On the table, the floor, the lawn or even at the beach.

name: Horse Around
description: A roll and move horse racing/betting game.  Each player has anywhere from 1 to 4 horses that race around the board.  The board is broken down into 4 "races".  Fees are paid to enter each race and bets can be placed on whether the horse wins, shows, or places (determined by die roll/odds).  Spaces on the board give player money, cause them to draw cards, cause them to gain additional horses, win/lose bets, etc.

name: Battle of Capua
description:
Part of the Roman Empire and home to many of the infamous Gladiators of the age, Capua became hotly contested in 212 BCE. In this quick card driven game for 2 to 4 players, you take on the role of a General trying to grab control of the city. In order to win, you will need to build a strong army and best your opponents through six battles.

The game is played over three phases. First, you draft cards to build you army and amass gold. Then, you use the gold to purchase battle upgrades via an auction. Finally, you pit your army against the armies of your opponents, trying to gain control of the six different districts of Capua. Each district you control makes your army that much stronger. In the end, the player who controls the most, and the most powerful districts will reign supreme over the city.

name: Reconquista
description:
Winner of the wargame category in the 2014 solitaire print and play contest. Released in early 2015 as a physical boardgame by White Dog Games.

The game is a solitaire area-movement wargame, simulating the Reconquest of the Iberian peninsular by the Christian kingdoms from the 8th to 15th centuries.

The player takes the role of the Christian forces. Starting off with a small part of Northern Spain, the player purchases Armies and cities, with the goal of defeating the Moslem forces and reconquering Iberia for Christendom.

Game play involves battles, sieges, random events, and the actions of the Moslem forces, controlled by the game.

Random events include Viking raiders, French intervention, Famine, Rebellions, Religious strife, Christian Military Orders, and more.

Components: 1 map, 100 counters (3 different sizes), rules.
Playing time: 1-2 hours

The White Dog games version contains cleaned-up rules, additional optional rules, including alternative random event tables, and a historical scenario for every one of the 20 turns of the game.

description:
Cardline: Dinosaures is similar to Cardline: Animals — but with dinosaurs! It is a card game played with approximately 100 cards. Both sides of each card depict a dinosaur, its name, its geographic place, while its average length and weight are printed on only one side of the card. At the start of the game, each player places a number of dinosaur cards on the table in front of her with the characteristics hidden. One card is placed in the center of the table with its characteristics revealed. Players then take turns placing a card from their tableau in a row on the table; a player can place a card between any two other cards. After placing the card, the player reveals the characteristics on it. If the card was placed correctly – that is, with the particular characteristic in numerical order compared to all other cards on the table – the card stays in place; otherwise the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck and adds it to her tableau.

The first player to get rid of all her cards by placing them correctly wins.

name: Tithe
description:
In feudal times, the different taxes levied upon the citizens were essential to maintain the prosperity of the kingdom and to overthrow other lords who taxed to much. Tithe is a fun card game in which four different kings struggle to raise more gold and to take power in the kingdom.

Tithe is a quick and easy game designed by Pablo Bella, for 2-4 players ages 8, lasting about 30 minutes.

In the game, players have hidden identities, and try to gain the power of the crown for their families. There are four kings in the game that make a deck of kings, and determine the predominant color in the course of the game.

In addition to the kings deck, there is a character deck. Players draw cards from this deck, and each round players will play character card to try to win the trick. Each character has a color (of the family), a strength value to measure victories in trick that are played and a value in gold (victory points).

When everybody plays one card strength and families are compared to determine which player wins the trick. This continues until all character cards from the deck have been played. But beware! It is not the player who wins the most tricks that wins the game, but the player that accumulates the most gold!

Tithe is a very quick and simple game, available in Spanish and English version and totally free for all Dizemo fans.

name: Superreich
description:
Objective: become the wealthiest player at the same time anyone is going bankrupt
 - moving/acting by turns -

Active player moves forward according spinner result (inner circle); ending on a 'country'-space spinner may be turned again, but outer circle determines, if purchase is: 
accepted/not accepted & money lost/for free;
You may add a house or - if you already own this property - proceed it.
Other spaces may force you to win/loose money or to gamble.
Ending on another player's property you must pay according status.

name: Bejinx
description: Bejinx cards are a game system that can be paired with any tabletop game. Pull a Bejinx card at the beginning of each turn, and follow its instructions. Some of the fun twists let you get extra turns in the paired game, see another player's hidden items, take another player's game items, or step into another player's shoes. A multigame booster also lets you play multiple interacting games at the same time.

name: The Treasure of Skull Rock
description:
From University Games: Do you have what it takes to find the treasure without waking up the haunted Skull? Travel along the treasure map in search of precious jewels - but watch out. Snatch them quickly before the Skull wakes up. Be quick and sneaky to make it around the island without losing the hard-earned booty.

The Treasure of Skull Rock:
Grab the treasure before the skull grabs you
Players race around the island collecting precious jewels from the haunted skull's treasure chest
Be the first to make it around the island and back to the ship with all your priceless loot

Contents include: haunted skull and treasure chest, 24 precious jewels, treasure map board, 4 playing pieces, die and instructions
For ages 8 years and up

name: Gathering of Guardians
description:
Players collect heroes to form the most renowned superhero team.  Players attempt to collect the most fame by the time the major threat is defeated.

Set-up includes an auction to determine starting training players have (which is used to break ties and unlock player powers).  Each turn is divided into two phases a recruit phase and an action phase.  In the recruit phase a player may attempt recruit heroes to gain training and unique abilities, or they can refresh their allies to ally for more actions to be taken.  In the action phase players have a variety of options including fighting villains, completing missions, or gathering resources.

Play continues until one play defeats the major threat (a randomly selected task that provides additional paths to victory).  At the game end fame is awarded to players based on accumulated training, completed missions, progress toward defeating the major threat, and captured villains.

name: Dystopian: the investigation deck game
description:
In Dystopian: the adventure deck game, one to four player assume the roles of Agents of the Dystopian Police Department (DPD) who are working to solve a murder.
They will work together, to search the city of Dystopia, among it's many different locations, first, looking for evidence to frame a suspect, then catching the criminal, before he escapes.

GAMEPLAY for a 1 player game: first thing, the player will choose 1 agent, each with a specific ability, and characteristic, then he'll choose a location, from where to begin his investigation.
Then, the player will form the investigation deck, which is composed of a mix of encounters (people and robots -called AI-Roids- that he will talk to, interrogate or "simply" attack that will help him with the investigation, or will hinder it), locations and clues.
There 12 locations, and each location can either be safe, neutral or dangerous. In safe locations, encounters will tend to be friendly, or harmless, while in dangerous locations, encounters will be aggressive and will be a liability to the player. Each encounter card shows three type of behaviors, and the player applies the one, associated to the location he was met. 
To deal with an encounter, the player will use action points. If the player has no action points, he will suffer the consequences, which will involve, eventually, spending time, and the player only has a limited amount of time/days/turns, to catch the culprit.

The player will have to go through the investigation deck, gaining clues and evidence, to frame the suspect, that will make the player understand where the criminal is hiding.
It's up to the player to determine how fast or slow he should investigate, keeping track of his action points, knowing where he's investigating, and managing his time, action points and the risks.

Once the player has gained enough evidence (in the evidence phase) he will decide wether to keep investigating, to gain more evidence which will limit the number of locations the murderer will try to hide in, or start looking for the criminal, early on (but with more places to search him, into).

Dystopian: the adventure deck game is the second installment in the dystopian trilogy, with Dystopian: the manhunt, and the soon to be finalized: Dystopian: raise and fall.

name: Sjov Gennem Europa
description:
Travel from Aalborg to Copenhagen via Norway, Iceland, Scotland, Ireland, Wales, England, France, Spain, Italy, Greece, Austria, Belguim, Holland, Germany, Finland and Sweden.

The first to reach the goal in Copenhagen wins. But be carefull! Landing on an orange spot can be good or bad news for you (move to another place or wait some turns). If you land on a red place you take one of the 24 Chance cards.

An exciting drive through all Europe. Family also for the little ones.

name: Kathmandu
description:
The Object

To score the most points after three rounds by arranging the entire hand into melds.

Materials 

52 card regular deck
22 tokens in two colors, 5 red and 17 blue
A way of keeping score

The Deck

A 52 card regular deck, ranked A-K-Q-J-10-9-8-7-6-5-4-3-2-A.

The Deal

The dealer shuffles the deck and one at a time deals out face down 10 cards to each player. The rest of the cards are placed face down in the center of the table forming the draw deck. Also each player takes 1 red token and places it in front of them.

Next place the remaining 3 red tokens adjacent to the draw deck and spaced about a card width apart from each other on the tableau. Then draw 2 cards from the draw deck placing them face up and adjacent to the red tokens.

The blue tokens are placed nearby so that both players can easily reach them.

Melds

Melds come in two flavors.

Group – Three or four cards with different suits and the same rank.
Sequence – Three or more cards of the same suit with ranks in sequential order.

The Play

The game is played in three rounds.

The non-dealer starts turns alternate.

A player on her turn must take one of the following actions.

1. Exchange a meld from your hand with a blue token, these cards are placed face down forming a discard pile or

2. Exchange an equal number of cards from your hand with red tokens from the tableau, these cards are placed face up to the tableau or

3. Take all of the red tokens from the tableau, replacing them with an equal number of cards from the draw deck, these cards are placed face up to the tableau or

4. Exchange any number of red tokens in your possession with an equal number of cards to the tableau or

5. Exchange any two cards from the tableau with two cards from your hand or

6. Take a red token from the tableau and replace it with a card from the draw deck, this card is placed face up to the tableau.

Players may have no more than 10 cards in their hands during play.

The game ends when either the draw deck is empty or all the blue tokens have been taken.

Scoring

Each blue token is worth 5 points each. Each red token is worth -2 points each and each card left in a player’s hand is worth -1 point each. Tally each player’s scores per round. Then tally each player’s final scores per round, the player with the highest score wins.

name: The Vine Game
description:
In The Vine Game you earn your fortune in the world of wine.  You can make money producing wine in your own vineyard or operating a winery.  You can also earn money trading in grapes, exporting grapes or by having the best combination of all those strategies.

At various times money, grapes or equipment can be in short supply so alliances and savvy trading between players will give you an advantage.  At some point you might need to trash yor alliances to break out on your own and go for gold.

The Vine Game uses money as the means of exchange and has a nice retro feel which will give it a broader cross generational appeal. So your dad will love it too!
